source_books: Science and Practice of Strength Training
evidence_base: Meta-analyses and systematic reviews on strength development

exercises.scientific_explanation: The pause bench press eliminates the stretch-shortening cycle contribution, requiring greater muscle force production. Research shows 8-12% greater muscle activation and improved force development at sticking points. Competition powerlifters demonstrate superior maximal strength development using paused variations compared to touch-and-go methods.
research_citations: Tillaar & Ettema (2013): Pause vs touch-and-go bench press
exercises.form_cue: Lower under control, pause 1-2 seconds on chest, drive up explosively
exercises.common_mistake: Relaxing during pause reduces muscle tension and training stimulus

exercises.scientific_explanation: Deficit deadlifts increase range of motion by 2-4 inches, providing greater muscle stretch and strength development through extended ROM. Research demonstrates 12-15% greater hamstring and glute activation compared to floor deadlifts. The exercise addresses sticking points at floor level and builds strength in mechanically disadvantaged positions.
research_citations: Swinton et al. (2012): Deadlift variations and muscle activation
Beckham et al. (2018): Deficit deadlift analysis
exercises.form_cue: Same form as regular deadlift but with increased range of motion from elevated platform
exercises.common_mistake: Excessive deficit height compromises form and increases injury risk

exercises.scientific_explanation: Close grip bench press shifts emphasis to triceps while maintaining compound movement benefits. EMG research shows 18-25% greater triceps activation compared to standard grip width. The exercise builds lockout strength for bench press while serving as primary triceps mass builder. Grip width at shoulder width optimizes triceps involvement.
research_citations: Lehman (2005): Grip width effects on muscle activation
Lockie & Moreno (2017): Close grip bench analysis
exercises.form_cue: Hands at shoulder width, elbows close to body, press straight up
exercises.common_mistake: Grip too narrow increases wrist stress without additional triceps activation

exercises.scientific_explanation: Weighted pull-ups allow progressive overload beyond bodyweight, essential for continued strength development. Research shows superior lat and rhomboid activation compared to lat pulldowns even at equivalent loads. The exercise develops maximal pulling strength and grip strength simultaneously while maintaining functional movement patterns.
research_citations: Signorile et al. (2002): Pull-up vs pulldown comparison
Youdas et al. (2010): EMG analysis of pulling exercises
exercises.form_cue: Add weight gradually, maintain full range of motion, control descent
exercises.common_mistake: Partial range of motion reduces muscle activation and strength gains

exercises.scientific_explanation: The bent-over row develops posterior chain strength through horizontal pulling while challenging core stability. Research shows highest lat and rhomboid activation among rowing variations. The exercise counteracts anterior dominance from pressing movements and improves posture through posterior chain strengthening.
research_citations: Lehman et al. (2004): Rowing exercise variations
Fenwick et al. (2009): Core muscle activation during rowing
exercises.form_cue: Hinge at hips, retract shoulder blades, pull elbows back toward ribs
exercises.common_mistake: Using momentum or standing too upright reduces target muscle activation

exercises.scientific_explanation: Box jumps develop maximal vertical power through concentric-only contractions, eliminating eccentric impact forces. Research shows power outputs of 4000-6000 watts in trained athletes. The exercise improves vertical jumping ability while reducing injury risk compared to depth jumps through controlled landing surface.
research_citations: Cormie et al. (2010): Power development training
exercises.form_cue: Explosive takeoff, pull knees to chest, soft landing on box
exercises.common_mistake: Jumping down instead of stepping down creates unnecessary eccentric stress
